sentence.Network_en: I looked and lo! every one of the fifteen men who had been standing with me had disappeared.
sentence.Network_cn: 我一看，哎哟！原来那15个和我站一起的家伙全没了踪影。

sentence.Network_en: He called the minister of the interior and, lo and behold, within about an hour, the prisoners were released.
sentence.Network_cn: 他给内政部长打了个电话，结果你看，不到一个钟头囚犯就给释放了。

sentence.Network_en: Lo, the manager remembered that he had never had so much.
sentence.Network_cn: 瞧, 经理记得他从未有过这么多钱.

jx.jx_en_mean: used to present a new scene, situation, or turn of events, often with the suggestion that though surprising, it could in fact have been predicted
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［用以介绍新景象、情况或事情的转变，常表示某事看似奇特但可以预料］哎哟看看

lj.lj_ly: you took me out and, lo and behold, I got home to find my house had been ransacked.
lj.lj_ls: 你把我弄出来，哎哟看看，我回到家却发现家里已被洗劫一空。

derivation.yuyuan_name: natural exclamation: first recorded as lā. in Old English; reinforced in Middle English by a shortened form of loke 'look!', imperative of look

entry.def: Lo and behold or lo is used to emphasize a surprising event that is about to be mentioned, or to emphasize in a humorous way that something is not surprising at all.

example.ex: He called the minister of the interior and, lo and behold, within about an hour, the prisoners were released...
example.tran: 他给内政部长打了个电话，结果你看，不到一个钟头囚犯就给释放了。

example.ex: I looked and lo! every one of the fifteen men who had been standing with me had disappeared.
example.tran: 我一看，哎哟！原来那15个和我站一起的家伙全没了踪影。
